pageContext.title: An unknown child
pageContext.description_physical:
The UV image shows the typical orange hue of the fluorescence coming from lead white, for instance evident on the lace of the headdress and white detailing of the dress. The pink UV fluorescence of the background suggests the use of organic dyes, likely also employed for the orange sash.
The x-ray image shows the lead-based detailing of the lace and dress, but almost no lead white seems to be applied for the flesh tones.
pageContext.pigments_costume: Clothing: lead white, carbon black (for shading); orange belt: earth pigment, lead white(?), red lead(?), gold; coral-coloured dummy cords: lead white, red lead(?), red organic dye
pageContext.pigments_flesh_tones_and_lips: Flesh tones: lead white, chalk, red lead(?); lips: red lead, red lake
pageContext.pigments_hair_and_beard: Earth pigments, lead white, red lead(?), lead tin yellow, carbon black
